text: uh hi everyone hearthony lost Tano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of this new Drake
and 21 Savage album her loss yes this is
a new collab record from Canadian singer
songwriter rapper Aubry Graham AKA Drake
as well as maybe the greatest rapper
from the UK
21 Savage who decided to team up for
this surprise record that was announced
a few weeks ago and I was pretty excited
for it honestly even though much of
Drake's solo work as of late has been
dreadfully boring teaming up with an
artist with a million times more street
cred than him could potentially pull a w
put Drake in a mode where he's maybe a
bit more aggressive and focused not to
mention his last major collaborative
effort what a time to be alive with
future had quite a few bangers on it
maybe Drake and 21 would strike up some
similarly exciting chemistry especially
on some low-key cold-blooded [ __ ] that
would be great and that's exactly what
we hear for the first leg of this record
whether that be the opener Rich Flex
with its multiple beat and flow switches
it's hard as hell but yeah on this track
draken 21 are sounding unbothered and
mean from front to back it's about as
great as an opener as I think you could
ask for then we have major distribution
which is not as bold does not feature as
great a hook but still scratches that
very uh mean and low-key itch the
beautiful and glamorous intro is really
nice as well sounds like something super
elegant off of Kanye record and with on
BS we get yet another hypnotic Banger
it's one of many tracks on this record
that are engineered so well the bass the
vocals the perks all come through so
crisp meanwhile on the lyrical front
Aubry and 21 are on this just endless
string of spicy flexes but it's really
their confident demeanor that sells it
these tracks really only account for one
mood or mode on the lp things begin to
morph as we go deeper into the record
Sliding Away From The Quiet Slaughter
gang [ __ ] the 21 Savage sounds so at
ease on in favor of cuts that are a bit
more buttery melodic and sweet there's
the under delivered privileged rappers
where Drake sounds especially checked
out on the vocal end the Sleepy synth
passages laced into the beat aren't
really helping and I don't think this
speed is really doing all that much for
21 Savages violent and weirdly sexual
bars here and there complaining about
his girl being on her period and wiping
his dick off on her bra 21 sounds even
more out of his element trying to sound
romantic but not really on spin about
you this kind of vibe is just not really
one that I think he thrives in however
Drake on the back end doesn't sound too
bad he kind of carries on this track but
that's not surprised a song of this
style and Vibe is kind of like a home
game for him however nobody is carrying
on the song hours in silence which
starts off smooth and catchy enough I
suppose but as soon as 21 comes through
with this embarrassingly bad sung
performance it's uh just a mess because
from there Drake pretty much subjects us
to this overly long vocal Odyssey uh
with no direction or end in sight most
of this track honestly is just a waste
of time but the Crown Jewel of the
center of this album has to be a Circo
Loco which has caused quite a stir
online not just because of it's a Daft
Punk sample in the instrumental but the
uh bar where Drake is very apparently
throwing a jab at Megan the stallion and
yeah the beat sucks the Daft Punk sample
is not really well placed in fact it's
so buried you can barely hear it and
Drake's attempt at an interpolated hook
uh of you know one more time is pretty
embarrassing in a total non-starter
thankfully things move in a more
positive direction past this point [ __ ]
and millions features a very Grand and
feel good trap beat as well as a decent
Travis Scott feature on the back end 21
Savage sounds especially expressive on
this track and Drake's vocal lines are
pretty on point meanwhile broke boys is
a woozy trap Banger probably the biggest
Banger on the record that we get since
you know the first several tracks on it
that and the murderous bought more ends
which is mostly dominated by 21 Savage
we have a few Drake solo cuts on the
record as well of course like we had on
what a time to be alive and um these are
mostly fine kind of a mixed bag though
middle of the ocean is kind of that
smooth classic diaristic Drake that we
know so well which is not entirely a bad
thing I think these songs when he's
really kind of in his feelings and going
over his past his successes his current
mindset it tends to be moments where
he's really focused not to mention some
of the best and most uh genius bars on
the entire record are on here the cirrus
cloud reference also like feeling like
an amber alert the way he takes her to
the mall and she finds Tiffany but by
that same token Jumbotron ship pop and
does absolutely nothing for me
especially since over much of the track
Drake sounds like he's doing his worst
Young Thug impression plus all these
goofy gunshot sounds with his mouth it's
just [ __ ] and 3am on Glenwood uh sees 21
Savage pretty much doing that diaristic
Drake thing
and he sounds kind of silly doing it
honestly even though he does get some
personal stuff off of his chest in the
process the closing track I will say is
pretty interesting I think in a way it
is a meta reflection on much of the
toxicity on the album so far Drake kind
of paints himself as somebody who is
being left in the dust at this point and
maybe that's due to his behavior maybe
that's because of her I guess in a way
of her loss at least that's what it
seems like his attitude is to a degree
but yeah honestly even though this
record has its Duds it really surpassed
my expectations in fact it was a lot
better than I thought it was going to be
especially given a lot of Drake's recent
output even if Drake did carry on a lot
of these tracks and 21 wasn't exactly
like the star of the show for most of it
like clearly Drake was The Guiding
personality for much of this project
still it seems like bringing him into
the fold in such a close and intimate
way has lit enough of a fire under
Drake's ass or inspired him to actually
have some goddamn fun to the point where
much of this album is actually tasteful
entertaining cool to listen to and not
nearly as corny as it could have been
spare those Jabs at black women that
just didn't really need to [ __ ]
happen in one breath I could say this is
Drake's best output in years but in
another consider what his output has
been over the past several years so even
if this is a a big Improvement what does
it really mean look all I really do know
is this album has quite a few bangers on
it well produced well-performed very
catchy very cold very mean and if you
could somehow see yourself through the
toxicity of it all I think you will get
quite a bit out of it but if not and you
want to pass on it I don't think there's
anything that you're really truly
missing anyway I'm feeling a decent too
strong six on this one transition have
you given this record to listen did you
love it did you hate it what would you
rate it you're the best or the best what
should I review next hit the like if you
